thread.title: Our fave things to do beginning Oct. 15
thread.title_full: Our fave things to do beginning Oct. 15

author: Dan England
title: Our fave things to do beginning Oct. 15
text: Expand Photo Adam Trent brings his youthful magic, dance and singing show to the Union Colony Civic Center, 701 10th Ave. in downtown Greeley, at 7 p.m. Tuesday. He was named one of the 10 most influential youths in the nation by "U.S. News and World Report." Tickets are available by calling (970) 356-5000 or going to ucstars.com. Expand Photo Greeley Central presents "12 Angry Jurors" at 7 p.m. today-Saturday at the high school auditorium, 1515 14th Ave. The story follows "12 Angry Men" on one man standing alone among 11 jurors who are convinced the accused is guilty. Call (970) 348-5084 for tickets. They are $5. Expand Photo The Greeley Philharmonic Orchestra brings Shakespeare's "Hamlet" to life through music paired with clips from the 1964 "Hamlet" film. The orchestra plays at 7:30 p.m. Saturday at the Union Colony Civic Center, 701 10th Ave. in downtown Greeley. Tickets are available by calling (970) 356-5000 or going to ucstars.com. Expand Photo Jacom Stephens | Joe Molina Gallery hosts salsa lessons and dancing from 7-9 p.m. Saturday at the gallery, 930 8th Ave. in downtown Greeley. The dancing is $5.
